Reviews.Title: “FOR EUR 50, IT'S A STEAL!”
Reviews.Author: fatih2011
Reviews.Content: Small, homey, 3-story hotel in central Sultanahmet. Easy walkable access to main sights. Double room + breakfast for EUR 50. Owner Hamit very friendly, helpful. So is other staff. Situated on main touristic street full of shops, restaurants. Rooms small, not tiny, clean, bright, with large windows, small TV, large bed, spotless bathroom. Room overlooking street. Double glazing windows block off 90% of noise. If open, hum-drum below is not so bad. Sounds from reception can be heard on 1st floor rooms. Breakfast basic, nutritious on top floor overlooking Sultanahmet and Ayasofya mosques. Would go again.

Reviews.Title: “If I went back to IST, I'd return to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: cvkstchr
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel, located on a busy, vibrant and active street in the tourist section of Sultanhamet. The Ayasofya & Blue Mosque are in walking distance and their domes and minarets can be seen from the rooftop. I really enjoyed my stay here. The owner and the front desk agent were so helpful with everything. The hotel is clean. The room had hardwood floors and a tiled bathroom. I think the most interesting aspect of the experience was the street on which Gul Sultan is located. At night the street comes alive with all the noise affliated with bars and people having a good time. In fact, it was noisey past 2am. There are so many other American English speaking tourists around and all the merchants and businesses catered to their needs very well. I would not recommend this place to a family seeking quite and refuge from the bustle of Istanbul, but I would recommend it to young adults or people 40 and under who want to have a good time and be in a safe, clean and well maintained place. Airport transportation can be arranged by the front desk, internet service is great, breakfast was good..

Reviews.Title: “Value for money and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Supratim
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a deal ! The location is awesome, its near to the Sultanahmet tram station, and the lane is full of other hotels and restaurants which are open till late night. Sultanahmet is 'THE' place to stay in Istanbul and we could visit a lot of places nearby because of its location. Places like Hagiya Sofia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Museum, Spice Bazaar, Grand Bazaar etc are at walking distance. You could also walk to the sea and take a ride on a boat when you want to ! The hotel has free internet, and very good and courteous staff. It also had complementary breakfast included which was average.

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant find in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: vandalmax
Reviews.Content: The hotel has small rooms but extremely clean and quiet if the rooms face the back (don't know how it is in the front but from what I could see they are larger). The ratings are high and reflect a budget travel. The good - prices (the best we could find roaming around), very clean rooms and bathrooms, location in Sultanahmet, friendly managers, free Internet (patchy reception on 2nd floor). The bad - No windows in the back room! breakfast has literally nothing - we finished bread baskets with butter and cheese but we didn't expect anything the low price so can ignore or simply eat elsewhere. I see pictures here of the terrace but we had a closed terrace probably cause of the weather. if it is open that would be a plus. The hotel is worth it since hostels charge you similar or higher rates. If you plan to spend all your time roaming in Istanbul and coming back only for sleep or breaks it is a brilliant place. Managers are friendly (look stern but that is just a look) so you can get a good price depending on timing.

Reviews.Title: “No frills, friendly service, good location”
Reviews.Author: r88my
Reviews.Content: If you are into luxury then this hotel isn't for you. The hotel was clean while not necessarily modern and maybe slightly overpriced. What it lacks in that respect it makes up with the fact that the manager is very friendly and so we enjoyed our stay. Location is but a leisurely walk to all the major sights in sultanahmet. My main gripe was the noise from the bars, cafes and people outside. Once the general noise had died down you could hear odd people here and there until really late. Bring a pair of ear plugs if you face the front. Otherwise get a room facing the rear.

Reviews.Title: “Great chance find in this area”
Reviews.Author: twinkletraveller
Reviews.Content: We initially booked in for one night as we'd arrived late and had tried to get into a couple of boutique hotels recommended by lonely planet (all were pricey and/or full). After spending a night here and having an excellent breakfast in the 3rd floor breakfast room with views (buffet style - traditional turkish (lots of it) with very fresh bread, fresh fruit and a choice of juices - and being perfect for the Topkapi/Blue Mosque/Agyia Sofia, we decided to stay on a further 4 nights - the room was very clean with tv and fridge and the staff were very friendly and very helpful. Our room was at the front of the hotel and overlooked the bars/restaurants in the street - although this was a little noisy at times, it was no real problem and was no more than we expected in the centre of Istanbul. If/when we go back to Istanbul we would/will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - shame about the noise”
Reviews.Author: Paul75003
Reviews.Content: Room was good - location great - staff friendly and really close to the major sights, but on a very noisy street. Impossible to sleep with the loud music, shouting, drum noises and car horns going on until 4am. The only way to drown out the noise was to turn the air-conditioning on full blast. If you're a light sleeper or you're not into late night partying this is not a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NOISY - Don't stay here if you want to sleep”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaMMs
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located, close to Topkapi, both mosques, public transport both tram & train. The hotel room & bathroom was clean and spacious. The rooms at the front have two windows (double glazed) that open to the street. The back rooms have a window but they have been bricked up which makes them dark. The hotel is located next to a hostel. Our room shared a common wall with the hostel and although you could not hear voices through the wall, every time anyone dragged a chair across the tiled floor in the common meal and bar room (open 24 hours) you could hear it through the wall. Despite the double glazed windows the noise from the many open-air restaurants in the street below disturbed our sleep. Most nights it died down around 2am but one night it went on until 4.30am. The breakfast was very disappointing. We were the only patrons at the hotel and we were given one egg, one bread roll, selection of jams, 2 small pieces of packaged cake, a few slices of tomatoes and cucumber and tea or coffee. The refrigerator did not efficently cool. Free internet usage in the foyer if you had your own computer. I would not stay at this hotel due to the noise despite its great location. Paid 60Euros per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good value, exceptional service at the Gul Sultan Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lilyanna2006
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a fantastic trip to Turkey and cannot say enough good things about The Gul Sultan Hostel. Like other reviewers said, the location is perfect, a stone's throw from the Hagia Sophia and a short walk from the Blue Mosque. The hotel is right in the middle of Backpackers Row but this is where you can get a good night's sleep as there is no party scene here. The walls in the bathroom actually shined, they were so clean! The room was spotless. Manager Hamit goes out of his way to be accommodating, which I so appreciated as a lone female traveller. He even woke up at 2:30 am to ensure my airport transfer went smoothly. Istanbul and Turkey have captured my heart and this hotel and the service provided played a part in it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: thor4217
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in the perfect location in Istanbul. It is right in the heart of the Sultanahmet, near all of the main Istanbul attractions. It is on a street with many other hotels and hostels, but is one of the more modern and newer establishments. Unlike many of the other hotels and hostels, it does not have a bar on the first floor, which my wife and I prefered after a hectic day walking around Istanbul. The rooms were clean and the bathroom was one of the nicer and more spacious ones we encountered in all of Europe. The owner was very helpful and courteous. A great value for the price. I would highly recommend it to other couples, backpackers and families.

Reviews.Title: “You won't get better value”
Reviews.Author: VancouverMike1
Reviews.Content: This is a modest but charming and exceptionally clean hotel. Bathrooms are modern; rooms even have crown moldings. Hamit, Metin and his wife are accommodating and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Nesa76
Reviews.Content: This lovely little hotel is right in the heart of the Sultanahmet action - just 5 mins from Hagia Sofia & the blue mosque. The room was basic but a good size, very tidy with a large ensuite bathroom. The hotel has a roof terrace with views over the Golden Horn. Breakfast was simple yet adequate. The owner, Hamit, was very helpful and friendly. The street is very busy and close to several mosques, so take ear plugs if you want a good nights sleep! We had an excellent holiday in Istanbul, a fabulous city!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and good value small hotel in Sultanhamet”
Reviews.Author: gkr_uk
Reviews.Content: The Gul Sultan is a small family-run hotel in Sultanhamet. Although the exterior is in the traditional style of Istanbul (clapperboard cladding), the hotel is only a few years old. The bedrooms are clean and well decorated with simple furnishings, the beds are comfortable, and the bathrooms (shower) are modern. Satellite TV in the rooms - BBC World available! Also with a small fridge for your own stuff (not a minibar). The owner, Hamit, is very helpful and nothing is too much trouble. Breakfast is typical Turkish, and served at the table in the breakfast room in the basement (no view). The terrace on the roof has views. This is an ideal place to stay in Sultanhamet, within easy walking distance of the main attractions and with some very nice restaurants nearby (in the same street). Simple, comfortable and clean. Excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home at the heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: venus5a
Reviews.Content: I was the hotel guest of Gul Sultan Hotel in 2006 and 2007 and have had a wonderful experience during my stay. The hotel is located in a very convient place at the historical centre of Istanbul, the magic city and the ancient capital of Turkey. It's easy to reach there from airport, railway station and tram stops. All the tourist attractions and souvenir shops are just in walking distance. The hotel is situated in a small street behind the famous Blue Mosque. It's a family runned hotel, a real 'boutique hotel'-small but elegant, clean and comfortable, tranquil and safe. The rooms are spacious and well furnished with well selected warm colored wooden furniture. The bathroom is large with full accessories. The hotel owner Mr Hamit is very nice and always give you a big welcome whenever you arrive. He has shown the generous hospitality of turkish people to all his hotel guests and he is always trying his best to make your stay comfortable. The reception area is like the living room of a familly, warm and cosy, where the hotel owner and guests can chat freely and enjoy the traditional turkish tea. The breakfast is served with care. The atmosphere is so pleasant that make you feel at home. Usually it's hard to find a home away from home in a foreign country. However, Gul Sultan Hotel is one of best family hotels in the world that I would like to recommand heartly to anyone who will visit Istanbul. Your stay at the hotel would definately make your visit a very pleasant one.

HotelInfo.Name: Gul Sultan Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Sultanahmet Akbiyik Caddesi No 9 | Eminonu, Istanbul 34122, Turkey
